Class Execute

  • java.lang.Object
    • bg.tu_varna.sit.oop1.Execute

  • public class Execute
extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • runProject

        public void runProject()
        Starts the execution of the application. It runs in a loop, processing input commands until an exit command is given.

      • ValidateArgumentsCount

        private boolean ValidateArgumentsCount(java.lang.String command,
                                       int argumentsCount,
                                       java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> validCommands)
        Validates if the given number of arguments matches the expected count for the specified command.
        Parameters:
        command - The command for which the arguments count needs validation.
        argumentsCount - The number of arguments provided.
        validCommands - A map containing valid commands and their corresponding expected argument counts.
        Returns:
        true if the provided arguments count matches the expected count for the command, otherwise false.

      • getCommands

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getCommands()
        Retrieves all commands and their corresponding argument counts as a HashMap.
        Returns:
        A HashMap containing commands as keys and their corresponding argument counts as values.

      • getFileName

        private java.lang.String getFileName(java.lang.String path)
        Extracts the file name from a given file path.
        Parameters:
        path - The file path.
        Returns:
        The extracted file name.
